wikipedia_page.main: Sean Rainbird (born March 1959) is a British art historian and museum director. Since April 2012 he has been Director of the National Gallery of Ireland.

response: Riley has written on artists from Nicolas Poussin to Bruce Nauman. She co-curated Piet Mondrian: From Nature to Abstraction (with Sean Rainbird) at the Tate Gallery in 1996.Bridget Riley The Stripe Paintings 1961–2014, June 13 – July 25, 2014 David Zwirner, London. Alongside art historian Robert Kudielka, Riley also served as curator of the 2002 exhibition "Paul Klee: The Nature of Creation", an exhibition at the Hayward Gallery in London in 2002.Alan Riding (10 March 2002), The Other Klee, the One Who's Not on Postcards The New York Times. In 2010, she curated an artists choice show at the National Gallery in London, choosing large figure paintings by Titian, Veronese, El Greco, Rubens, Poussin, and Paul Cézanne.Hilary Spurling (27 November 2010), Bridget Riley at the National Gallery – review The Guardian.Martin Gayford (10 December 2010), Colors Shimmer as Bridget Riley Confronts Old Masters: Review Bloomberg.

The National Gallery of Ireland () houses the national collection of Irish and European art. It is located in the centre of Dublin with one entrance on Merrion Square, beside Leinster House, and another on Clare Street. It was founded in 1854 and opened its doors ten years later. The gallery has an extensive, representative collection of Irish paintings and is also notable for its Italian Baroque and Dutch masters painting. The current director is Sean Rainbird.
